name: Alex Everly
title: Product Designer & Design Technologist
bio_short: Designs human, fast, and polished product experiences across web and mobile.
bio_long: I am a product designer who blends rigorous UX research with crisp interaction design and motion craft. I ship reliable UI systems, prototype quickly in code, and love translating complex workflows into clear, friendly interfaces.
process_steps: Discover: map the problem with research, metrics, and jobs-to-be-done.
Define: narrow scope, frame success metrics, storyboard ideal flows.
Design: craft IA, interaction patterns, motion, and accessibility checks.
Deliver: build coded prototypes, partner with engineering, document in the system.
Measure: ship, instrument, learn, and iterate quickly.

projects.name: Orbit Bank
projects.summary: Rebuilt the consumer banking app with faster onboarding and consistent tokens.
projects.problem: Inconsistent UI patterns slowed new feature delivery and created accessibility regressions.
projects.approach: Audited flows, created motion + component tokens, prototyped transitions in Framer, paired with engineering to codify behaviors.
projects.outcome: Shipped a unified design system that cut build time by 30% and raised app store rating by 0.4 stars.

projects.name: Lumia Launch
projects.summary: Motion-first launch site for a smart light product line.
projects.problem: Needed a memorable, performant story to convey ambient lighting features.
projects.approach: Storyboarded hero moments, built WebGL-friendly motion studies, optimized lottie playback for low-end devices.
projects.outcome: Lifted time-on-site by 22% and reduced bounce during hero segment by 15%.

projects.name: Trailmix
projects.summary: Social trail planning app with offline-first navigation.
projects.problem: Hikers struggled to plan routes with clear difficulty and safety cues.
projects.approach: Ran diary studies, redesigned route cards, prototyped haptic cues and offline states.
projects.outcome: Beta cohort reported 18% fewer navigation drop-offs; NPS +12.

projects.name: Atelier CMS
projects.summary: Composable CMS UI for multi-brand editorial teams.
projects.problem: Editors duplicated layouts per brand and lacked guardrails for accessibility.
projects.approach: Built layout primitives with constraints, tokenized typography, and preview modes.
projects.outcome: Reduced template creation time by 40% and improved AA color compliance.
